content:
I've made the following changes:

Output
* Changed "The" to "Two space-separated".

Constraints
* I've formatted the variables in Constraints section (previously not formatted).

Tags
* I've added the tag "Sequences".

Cool problem!

I've fixed one of your "Kolakoski" that was spelled as "Kalakoski".

As far as the description goes, you might want to specify a little bit more: in CS contexts, RLE usually means run length *and* original symbol, which isn't the case here.
Is it better with the additional example ?

(it looks like it changed since I wrote this, and it's better indeed---there's an "encoding" left in the header, which is not as bad, but could possibly made more clear by rephrasing as:)

"(...) is an infinite sequence of numbers whose run lengths reduce to the sequence itself."

(got chat-approved by pb4GOD :D )

A few very minor edits, for tracking:
- put the author back in (I may have been unclear on the chat: when I said get rid of the parenthesis, I didn't mean its contents, just the typographical marks)
- compressed the monospace section laterally (it overflowed my default window size on two monitors attempts)
- slightly reworded the recursion and the problem expectation
- sprinkled bits of bold, constant and variable face. And trimmed a linefeed.

I was still not very happy with the statement, so I have changed it a little.

Tell me if it is okay for you and I will approve this puzzle.
